responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: "Use of Netty RPC without proper input validation and service method authentication."
    analysis: |
      The provided RPC implementation does not enforce proper validation of the input across the various methods exposed via RPC, potentially allowing an attacker to inject unexpected data or trigger unexpected behavior. It lacks service method level access control or authentication, meaning any client that can connect to the server potentially has access to all exposed methods without any form of credential or permission check. This flaw exposes critical operations to unauthorized users.
    cwe: CWE-306
    function_names:
      - "RpcServerHandler.handle"
      - "invoke"
    filenames:
      - "netty-rpc-test/src/main/java/com/app/test/service/HelloServiceImpl.java"
      - "netty-rpc-client/src/main/java/com/netty/rpc/client/proxy/ObjectProxy.java"
    classification: "very promising"
```

leads.headline: Use of Netty RPC without proper input validation and service method authentication.
leads.analysis: The provided RPC implementation does not enforce proper validation of the input across the various methods exposed via RPC, potentially allowing an attacker to inject unexpected data or trigger unexpected behavior. It lacks service method level access control or authentication, meaning any client that can connect to the server potentially has access to all exposed methods without any form of credential or permission check. This flaw exposes critical operations to unauthorized users.
